zone.line: many yet lie covered in these a the ashes
of their birth, & pregnant with a
lightning which has yet found no conductor
-ductor. In all high poetry is infinite.
it is as the first acorn which containd
all oaks potentially; veil after veil may
be undrawn & the inmost naked beauty
of the meaning never exposed. A great
poem is a fountain forever overflowing
with the waters of wisdom & delight;
a
and after one person or one age has
exhausted all of its divine effluence
thier them
which its peculiar relations enable it
to share; another & yet another
succeeds, and f new relations are
ever developed, the source of an
unforeseen & unconcieved delight

line.del: Poetry is as the a star whose light
is so intense & whose height so
at the most distant extremities of the orbit of a

zone.line: The age immediately succeeding to
that of Dante Petrarch & Boccacio
